items.sentence: You should tell Tom that Mary isn't planning on staying.
You ought to tell Tom that you aren't planning on going.
You know that Tom is still planning on going, don't you?
That's what Tom suggested, and I think it's worth a try.
Tom and Mary both walked into the room at the same time.
How many people were sitting at the table next to yours?
I'd like it here if it didn't get so cold in the winter.
I wonder how many people come to visit Boston each year.
My mother gets up earlier than anyone else in my family.
Authorities say that Tom Jackson is expected to survive.
You should've locked, or at least closed, all the doors.
What did you make with the lumber that you got from Tom?
Tom's French improved after he started studying grammar.
We learn from history that we do not learn from history.
Tom's book about his life with Mary sold like hot cakes.
Tom stayed up late into the night working on his speech.
Tom's apartment looks great after he had it re-carpeted.
Tom looked at the menu and decided to order a fish dish.
At 90, Tom's grandfather still leads a very active life.
Tom isn't much of a cook, but at least he gives it a go.
